fields.description:
Nowadays on the end of the installation/upgrade process the service/application is started.
This way users with custom configuration can re-apply it without having to wait for the application to start and settle before shutting it down again to re-apply custom configuration.
fields.summary: Optional startup of the application/service at the end of the installation.

fields.description:
Sometimes, reStructuredText is preferred over markdown.
For those repositories, it will be nice to display the processed text in NAVIGATION > Source

Addendum: For this to be possible, ideally the readme rendering should be made pluggable.
fields.summary: Ability to render other README formats, such as reStructuredText

fields.description: I would like an indication that there are file comments when comments are hidden in diffs. This happens for inline comments.
fields.summary: Indicate presence of file comments when comments are hidden in diff view

fields.description:
Scenario

* Commit something on a branch
* push branch to origin
* Create pull request - don't merge
* Commit something else
* push branch to origin
* try to create a pull request
Pull request creation is declined as a pull request exist already
* Check first pull request
(!) See that the pull request is not updated with the new commit
* Check hooks
All 4 hooks are available and executable
* Merge first pull request
(!) See that the second commit is included in the merge
fields.summary: Pull request not refreshed after commit, but commit is included in the merge

fields.description:
*Scenario:*
# Create a pull request from a branch in a forked repository back to the main repository
# In a local checkout, fetch the branch from the forked repository and push it to the main repository
# Delete the branch from the main repository, but leave the branch in the fork

*Expected result:*
The pull request is unaffected, because neither the source branch (in the fork) nor the destination branch (in the main repository) were changed

*Actual result:*
Stash declines the pull request when the branch in the main repository is deleted. The pull request cannot be re-opened because stash believes the source branch has been deleted.

*Workaround:*
Push the branch to the local repository, and delete it once the pull request has been merged.
fields.summary: Fork sync deletes branches which are in a pull request

fields.description:
Hello currently we are developing Go and using Stash to hold our source code.
Currently the 'go get' command doesn't work quite well with stash.

if i do 'go get' i get the following:
stash/organization/myproj.git/
as the directoy structure
currently there are some implementations that the .git won't get appended.

> http://golang.org/cmd/go/#hdr-Remote_import_paths

it would be great if this is possible at all.
fields.summary: Add support for go get

fields.description:
As far as I know, there are currently no notifications related to pull request tasks.  When creating a task in response to a reviewer comment, I would like to send an email notification to let that reviewer (and the other watchers) know that the comment is going to be addressed or has been addressed.  Right now, I have to create the task and then add a comment noting that I agree with the suggested change or that the change was completed.

As noted in STASH-4496, it would be beneficial to be able to turn these notifications on/off.
fields.summary: Send email notification on task creation and completion

fields.description:
This issue does *not* happen consistently, hence making it difficult to reproduce.

h4. Reproduction steps
# Link Stash to Delagated LDAP
# Edit LDAP Settings to enable or disable "Copy User on login"
# Login to Stash with an account from LDAP that is not created in Stash

h4. Expected Behavior
The result follows according to the setting preference

h4. Actual Behavior
h5. With "Copy Users" enabled
Invalid username and password error is thrown
h5. With "Copy Users" disabled
The account is created in Stash and logon is permitted

h4. Note
The occurrence is random and is solved by restarting Stash.
fields.summary: "Copy User on Login" setting is not saved properly when saving Delegated LDAP settings

fields.description:
I would like to be able to search for a specific piece of text in all files, in all projects, through a repository (even all repositories).

The latest version of the master branch of each project would a good enough candidate, for starters.

Of course, the more search criteria, the better (like excluding repos/projects or searching through specific branches of projects).

My use-case : I want to search where (which project and in what files) a java class from one project is being used (it might be used as Spring bean and declared in an xml file)
fields.summary: Search for text in all repos

fields.description:
Currently, if we have 10 open pull requests to master, and one of them gets merged, Stash does NOT update refs/pull-requests/*/merge branches for all remaining open pull requests. It updates the corresponding branches only after you open the pull request pages in your browser.

I suggest that Stash should auto-merge all open pull requests ASAP in this case. This would be the most logical and correct thing to do. CI systems will pick up and build all open pull requests ASAP and so the next time someone opens a pull request the status will already be up to date.

Stash developers argue that the lazy ref updates have been implemented to improve performance. But this should only be enabled in Stash installations that actually have a performance problem. Let it be a configuration option.
fields.summary: Auto re-merge all open pull requests on destination branch updates

fields.description: Provide a checkbox to use or disable automerge at the pull request merge page that overrides the value set in repository settings
fields.summary: Provide an option to override automerge option value in the pull request merge screen

fields.description:
When rendering the branch list page, if non-UTF-8 commit messages are encountered, Jackson will abort JSON production, leaving an incomplete JSON object (see end of description for stack trace).

The likely cause is a user setting their accepted character encoding for git to a non-UTF-8 character set (eg EUC-JP). Stash assumes the git default is used by all users.

Pending reproduction there are likely to be two approaches:
# remove the commit messages from the branch list JSON before rendering; this will only be a stop-gap as it does not prevent the problem occurring in other parts of the application
# perform normalization or non-UTF-8 character stripping at read time; this will be more time consuming to implement but a more robust solution

fields.description: The mail server configuration page fills in the current mail server password in the html and it should not. Instead a place-holder value should be used instead of the current password value and if the place-holder value is submitted in a request then the mail server password is not updated.
fields.summary: Mail sever configuration page sends mail server password back in the html

fields.description:
Plugins want to add their own activities to a PR overview.

Some are already hacking this into the page in unsupportable ways (e.g. https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.bolyuba.stash.plugin.stash-block-pullrequest-plugin)

An API to add your own activity to a PR would make this easier to support and maintain, and would give a lot of power to plugins.
fields.summary: Pluggable activities

fields.description: We would like to be able to place comments on source code files that are not part of a commit or Pull Request.  This way we can comment on things that we find without having to actually commit any code.
fields.summary: Allow comments on source code

fields.description:
When you visit a pull request page, the merge button shows as enabled while the 'can merge' state is loaded. This may arouse the misleading feeling that a pull request is merge-able when it's not, especially when using a merge driver where a merge may take several seconds to finish.

Suggestion: Show a static "loading" picture until the 'can merge' state is known.
fields.summary: Merge button in Pull Requests shows enabled while 'can merge' state is loading

fields.description:
*Story:* _As a user I would like to know which of the repos I am able to view I have do not have write access to so that I can contact the project owner in order to be able to commit to their repo_

In our specific situation we have an internal policy all projects and repos in stash should be public for the purposes of discoverability, however, the project owner is able to determine who has write access to a repo.  As stash exists currently users are not able to *determine whether they have write access to a repo*, and in the case they do not they are unable to *determine who they need to contact in order to get write access*

Thanks!
fields.summary: Ability for users to see which repos they have write permission to

fields.description:
The referenced Stash documentation PDF for 3.3 on confluence.atlassian.com is not accessible: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ALLDOC/Stash+Documentation+Directory#StashDocumentationDirectory-downloads], it returns a 403 Forbidden error, whereas earlier versions of the PDF are accessible. The problematic link is: [https://downloads.atlassian.com/software/stash/downloads/documentation/STASH-3_3_0-20140910-PDF.pdf].


Reference ticket: [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/SSP-5912].
fields.summary: Documentation unavailable for 3.3.x
Update "Stash upgrade guide" documentation

fields.description: Based on https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Transitioning+from+jTDS+to+Microsoft's+JDBC+driver the jTDS driver was replaced with the one from Microsoft because support for Java 6 was still required in Stash. Now that Java 6 has been deprecated in Stash 3.0+ it would be nice to support the jTDS driver so that Windows Authentication Mode can be used on linux when connecting to a MS SQL Database.
fields.summary: Support the jTDS Driver again so that Windows Authentication Mode can be used on Linux

fields.description:
As per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Connecting+Stash+to+Crowd] the Crowd URL should be specified as e.g. [http://www.example.com:8095/crowd/], but there is no warn in case the user inserts an invalid URL (e.g. [http://www.example.com:8095/crowd/services/].

The suggestion of validating it serves to prevent errors and misconfigurations.
fields.summary: Validate URL when integrating with Crowd

fields.description:
We have a reporting requirement to find out all commits between two dates across all branches.
There doesn't seem to be a way to do this using the REST API directly.

Can we please add this in the REST API  ?

Thanks
fields.summary: The stash REST API does not have something to query all commits across all branches between two given dates

fields.description:
The email and username password in the email server settings screen has the same names as the username and password fields when logging in.

This has the unintentional side affect of being pre-populated by your browser if you have left the mail server credentials blank and your browser has saved your login credentials.

Changing another element on the form (in our case, email from), and not noticing the username and password fields have been auto-populated, results in your director's password being saved as the mail server password, and being available to all admins, in plain-text (via inspect source) next time the page loads.

Fix: don't use the same field names (username and password) for the login field and email server settings.
fields.summary: Stash email settings fields can be inadvertently be populated by browser with user login details - security issue

fields.description: Some node in Stash cluster, what can have different version of plugins. This node will be used to test stability of plugins in production environment, but other users will not use it.
fields.summary: In Stash Data Center create prestable node for testing plugins

fields.description: Now system admin can install plugins, update them, enable and disable. Will be nice to have 'Plugins Admin' role, to control only plugins.
fields.summary: Separate rights to install/update/uninstall/enable/disable plugins
Send email if new plugin installed or updated to new version

fields.description:
Some plugins, such as our automerge plugin (it try to merge pull requests automatically if it possible) and other functions, changed Git repos automatically in background task may depends on plugins or system settings behaviour.

Will be nice to have Stash System State ID, some hash about System settings (not all, but critical) and plugins set (not all, but such plugin with special attibute like 'critical'). If this hash changed, then all plugins (maked as depended on critical, or just marked as 'background jobs' inside) disabled and Stash show red alert on top with message for Administrator like this 'The system settings or plugins are updated, please review changes and Approve it'. Then System Administrator pressed Approve, all disabled function became back to working state.
fields.summary: Detect system changes and disable dangerous functions/plugins until admin Approvement

fields.description: Provide an option to users to prevent the Pull Request URL being displayed after a push.
fields.summary: Option to disable Pull Request URL display after Push

fields.description:
In the merge dialog, Stash shows a list of the branches it's about to auto-merge into.

There are some cases where you want to prevent those changes from being merged into a release branch - perhaps because there has been a refactor in a particular release and a different fix was applied already (or will be applied in the future by another branch and PR).

This suggestion is for the ability to elect a branch where the change will stop propagating. The automerge will still technically propagate through all releases, but it will be a no-op change into that branch and all branches after it because the merge will be done with the "strategy=ours" option set.
fields.summary: Allow me to set a merge s="ours" point in the auto-merge chain

fields.description:

We have recently reviewed this issue and the overall interest in the problem. As the issue hasn't collect votes, watchers, comments, or support cases from many customers during its lifetime, it's very low on our priority list, and will not be fixed in the foreseeable future. That's why we've decided to resolve it as *Timed Out*.

Although we're aware the issue is still important to those of you who were involved in the conversations around it, we want to be clear in managing your expectations. Imran Khan
Product Manager - Bitbucket Server and Data Center

It would be very helpful to have a resource in the RESTful API to retrieve the currently authenticated user.

The "whoami" servlet seems only to work with a username&password session, and not with an OAuth Token.
I'm currently working on a Continuous Delivery solution that connects to Stash. And not knowing which user is authenticated is really blocking.
fields.summary: RESTful Resource to retrieve the authenticated user

fields.description:
We have JIRA 6.2.5 integrated with Stash.

I had disabled the Keyboard Shortcuts Plugin in Stash, with the intent of preventing users from accidentally approving Pull Requests.  As a result, when a user clicked on the 'Create Branch' link in JIRA, it would take them to Stash and they would see the Skull & Crossbones "Contact your system admin" error.

I looked at the atlassian-stash.log in the stash home directory and found the following:
{code}2014-10-09 11:55:01,921 ERROR [http-bio-7990-exec-4407] 715x6219402x0 1iq1m3f 192.168.27.97 "GET /mvc/error500 HTTP/1.1" c.a.s.i.web.ErrorPageController There was an unhandled error loading [/plugins/servlet/create-branch]
2014-10-09 11:55:01,966 WARN  [http-bio-7990-exec-4407] 715x6219402x0 1iq1m3f 192.168.27.97 "GET /mvc/error500 HTTP/1.1" c.a.p.w.DefaultResourceDependencyResolver Cannot include disabled web resource module: com{code} 

The only change I made to Stash recently was disabling this plugin, so I tried reenabling it, and the problem went away.  It looks like theres some dependency on the plugin for creating a new branch (at least in the versions I'm using)
fields.summary: Disabling Keyboard Shortcuts Plugin breaks Jira/Stash branch creation link

fields.description: Repos containing over 100k files don't allow some of them to be found.
fields.summary: Repos containing over 100k files don't allow some of them to be found

fields.description:
Especially stash.changeset.related-entities

This will allow plugin devs to use our built-in commit- and repository-specific conditions on their client-web-fragments.

See 
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/9387538/answers/9387603/comments/9387608 for details.
fields.summary: Add repository and changeset objects to server-side context for client-web-fragments on the changeset page.

fields.description:
Nowadays Stash keeps the ports configuration in the server.xml file which is distributed with the installation file.
This said, when an upgrade/reinstall is made, the ports should be set again.
It would make the customers life easier if we could store this information in a file under STASH_HOME, so in the upgrade process the ports will me kept.
fields.summary: Keep the ports configuration during Stash upgrade/reinstall.

When a pull request gets rejected, there is no opportunity to provide a reason. An email is sent out that just says unapproved and another emails are sent with the reason but it does not seems to be related to the reject pull request.
The same happens for the approvals.
If there was a way to require the user a reason on rejecting or approving a oull request, this information could be send with the first email sent.
fields.summary: Stash pull request notification with more information.

fields.description:
When browsing to the pull request list of a repository, we don't see the current build status in the table.
We have to enter in each pull request to see the actual build status.

This information is well displayed in the *branches* screen, I believe it makes sense to be also displayed for pull requests.
fields.summary: Show build status in pull request list screen

fields.description:
If you delete a user via the REST API (i.e. {{http://<HOST>:7990/rest/api/1.0/admin/users?name=test}}), it does not clear out the user from the {{Project Permissions}} page.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a user, {{test}. for example.
# Give the user permissions in a project.
# Delete this user from the REST API. (i.e. {{http://<HOST>:7990/rest/api/1.0/admin/users?name=test}}).
# Go to the permissions page for the project you set earlier.

You will notice that the user is shown as its username, rather than the display name, and clicking on the link will take you to a 404 page.
fields.summary: Permissions for deleted users have broken links

fields.description:
Sometimes the Pull Request Inbox doesn't show more than 10 pull requests. No errors are shown in the logs. For me it is reproducible only once for each user, by the time the user logs in for the first time.

*Using Firefox 32.0.3 in OSX*
*Steps to reproduce:*
# Created 1 branch from master (feature/1.0) and applied a change to it.
# Created another 11 branches (feature/1 to feature/11) from master.
# Created 11 pull requests, from *feature1.0* to the other branches, adding another user as a reviewer.
# Logout with the user who created the pull requests, and login with the reviewer.
# Click in the Pull Request Inbox and check there are only 10 pull requests listed, despite the number in the icon shows there is 11:
!inbox1.png|thumbnail!
*Notice* it doesn't indicate in the bottom that there are *No more pull requests*.

After logging out and in again with the same user, the list is full:
!inbox2.png|thumbnail!

With logs in debug mode, all the information I could see related to *inbox* is the following, but I'm not sure it is related to rendering the content in the Pull Request Inbox:
{noformat}

{noformat}
{noformat}

{noformat}

*Also happens in Chrome - version 37.0.2062.124:*
* I also tested logging with another user for the first time in Chrome, and the error is present there too, same way as in Firefox (it seems it doesn't load fully also, as the *No more pull requests* message is not there).
* After logging out and in again, the issue is gone.

The browser's console only mentions a deprecated method, but this is shown with or without the issue in place (both for Firefox and Chrome):
!console.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*
If the issue persists even after logging out and in again, currently the only workaround is to look at the Pull Requests list directly into the repository:
# Go to *Repositories* in the top bar > click in the repository name.
# In the left panel click in *Pull Requests*.
# Look at the tab *Open* for your opened Pull Requests.
fields.summary: Pull request inbox sometimes not showing more than 10 results

fields.description:
As pointed out in STASH-5335, the
[TemporaryAvatarController.save|https://stash.dev.internal.atlassian.com/projects/STASH/repos/stash/browse/webapp/default/src/main/java/com/atlassian/stash/internal/web/avatar/TemporaryAvatarController.java#65] resource is vulnerable to [CSRF|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-site_request_forgery]. Currently there appears to be no impact of it being vulnerable except for making a user upload a temporary avatar file (which are periodically deleted).
fields.summary: TemporaryAvatarController.save is vulnerable to CSRF/XSRF

fields.description:
Stash, as 2.12, will allows users to upload local avatars to their account (STASHDEV-6182).

That upload is submitted to a (non-API) end point that accepts a POST request with the avatar as [data-uri|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_Uri].

Currently, because the form is submitted by AJAX, the end point is annotated with {{@IgnoresXsrf}}, as the front-end doesn't have a security token to submit along with the request. See [UserProfileController.uploadAvatar|https://stash.dev.internal.atlassian.com/projects/STASH/repos/stash/browse/webapp/default/src/main/java/com/atlassian/stash/internal/web/users/UserProfileController.java#65] for the source.

The two alternatives to fix this (and remove the annotation) are:
- submit the data as JSON instead of {{form-urlencoded}},
- get hold of a security token/value in the page and submit it as part of the AJAX request.
fields.summary: User avatar upload endpoint is vulnerable to XSRF

fields.description:
Nowadays, when the LDAP server has the same user under different OU's,  Stash finds it under the first OU available and skips to synchronise the other OU's information, like groups where the same user is configured, so Stash is not displaying all the groups where this user is under.
E.g.
I have a ldap server with this user: "User = dev_a"
*Structure*
* dc=example dc=com
# OU = East
memberOf=devs_project_a
# OU = West
memberOf=devs_project_b

In Stash the user has 2 directories to synchronise both LDAP servers, but the user is the same under both, so he will not be under "devs_project_b" in Stash after synchronisation.

There should be a way to have a (even that slower to complete) full synchronisation option to be enabled and get all memberOf where that user is found.
In Stash each OU is configured as a User directory because configuring Stash to use only the DC's the in the attachment is displayed.
fields.summary: User LDAP synchronisation under different OU's

fields.description:
Currently Stash only support deletion of user. Is it possible to add lock user or disable account function to Stash? 

The scenario of this function is that one of our colleague left the company. Deleting his account also delete his ssh key and all related info. We are not sure what's the impact and cannot un-delete an account.
fields.summary: Admin can disable user account

fields.description:
In comments made in PRs we often refer to files in our projects (naturally enough). Since we are a Windows shop the path to those files normally does contain backslashes. In the Stash comments (and even in other Atlassian products this also seems to be true (only tested in Jira).

In the markdown docs there is no mention that backslash is an escape character. The simple solution would be to add documentation for this. I would however strongly advise against that. file-paths are *very* common in these comments and the Windows user base is significant (I would guess). 

The better solution, IMHO, would be to either:
1. Remove escape option (undocumented feature already = "no" harm done...)
2. Make another character the escape character (i.e. use a character that is much rarer to control this)
3. Make the escape character configurable (default is \ for backwards compatibility). We, as a Windows shop, could then change this to i.e. ¤.
fields.summary: Backslash escapes for Markdown should be documented

fields.description:
*Problem*
On Stash 3.3.0 and 3.3.1 some plugins may report {{Incompatible with product license (wrong type)}}, while the product license (Stash) matches the tier/type for the add-on license.

This behavior has been observed with Open Source (unlimited) licenses and the [NotifyR plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/nl.stefankohler.stash.stash-notification-plugin], but others may be affected too.

*Workaround*

If on Stash 3.2.4+, upgrade the UPM:

# Check if the UPM can be updated in [online mode|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Updating+the+Universal+Plugin+Manager#UpdatingtheUniversalPluginManager-Stash#UpdatingtheUniversalPluginManager-UpdatingUPMinonlinemode], if can be, update it. Otherwise use the following guide:
# [Download the UPM add-on 2.18.2 from its Marketplace space|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin]
# Follow the instructions below to update it in your instance:
## [Updating the Universal Plugin Manager|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Updating+the+Universal+Plugin+Manager#UpdatingtheUniversalPluginManager-Stash]

Alternatively, apply an evaluation license for the add-on until and upgrade to 3.5+ can be scheduled.
fields.summary: Plugin reports "Incompatible with product license (wrong type)"

fields.description:
It is a bit like a sobriety test to get the action menu to open and actually select something.  Any diagonal mouse movement (as opposed to moving exactly horizontal) from the hover button over to the popup menu will dismiss the menu.  Additionally, if you happen to move slightly left back toward the button, it will also dismiss the popup.

Generally with this sort of thing, you create a larger virtual active area as soon as the popup is open (which includes the button, the popup, and a little buffer around the whole thing) and you need to move outside of that to dismiss the popup.  For bonus points, you provide a timer where you are allowed to leave the active area for a short duration before the popup dismisses, this handles the overshoot case.

I set the priority to 'minor' but really, creating pull requests easily is a pretty major function in the product.
fields.summary: Show all action icons in collapsed sidebar

fields.description:
I first noticed this issue when I had the YACC plugin to authenticate Stash User names against Git use renames as a pre-commit hook server side.  

I had a new employee trying to use stash so we made a new repo for them and followed the directions that stash prints out how to set username and email:

{{git config --global user.name "USERNAME"}}
{{git config --global user.email "EMAIL"}}

The issue we ran into is that the employees name ends in a period (Last Name, First Name Initial PERIOD)

It "appears" that git is stripping trailing periods off the username when you make a commit.  So my suggestion would be to update this information to provide a correct _git compatible_ username.

I opened an initial bug with the YACC plugin which you can see here:


https://github.com/sford/yet-another-commit-checker/issues/30#issuecomment-57577851
As seen the YACC maintainer was able to duplicate my issue:

{code}
cd periodtest/
git init
git config user.name "Test."

# verify that user.name is 'Test.'
git config user.name

touch README
git add README
git commit -a -m "period test"

# check user name after commit
git log 
{code}

And the resulting commit w/out the period was:  

{code}
commit 9b7e4960fd8129059b5759d1bb937b60241fd70b
Author: Test <email@test.com>
Date:   Wed Oct 1 20:28:28 2014 -0700

    period test
{code}


*UPDATE:*  According to a reply on my stack overflow post: http://stackoverflow.com/a/26219423/2069812 - this is actually true git behavior and it will truncate various characters from the end of the line.
fields.summary: Stash Provided directions create invalid user.name if name ends in period

fields.description:
If you change any flags setting two-legged oauth, or change the impersonation flag, then the opposite side of the link is not updated to match this. This means you can create situations where the configuration is actually mismatched to the point that it breaks the application link.

For example:

# Set up an application link with default settings and "The servers have the same set of users and usernames" to produce an OAuth configuration with 2LO and impersonation enabled
# Remove impersonation from the incoming authentication configuration of either or both ends of the link
# The link is now broken

After the link is broken this way, if you make any change whatsoever to the link, it will not be reflected on the other side. This includes deleting the link not trying to delete the other side of the link.

As long as the flags remain compatible, however, if you disable or enable the entire OAuth section, it will be correctly reflected in the other side of the link.
fields.summary: Updating 2LO and 2LOi flags on incoming authentication does not update corresponding outgoing authentication on opposite site of link and vice versa

Hi everyone,

We have recently reviewed this issue and the overall interest in the problem. As the issue hasn't collect votes, watchers, comments, or support cases from many customers during its lifetime, it's very low on our priority list, and will not be fixed in the foreseeable future. That's why we've decided to resolve it as *Timed Out*.

Although we're aware the issue is still important to those of you who were involved in the conversations around it, we want to be clear in managing your expectations. The Bitbucket Server team is focusing on issues that have broad impact and high value, reflected by the number of comments, votes, support cases, and customers interested. Please consult the [Atlassian Bugfix Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-bug-fixing-policy-201294573.html] for more details.

We understand how disappointing this decision may be, but we hope you'll appreciate our transparent approach and communication. Imran Khan

fields.description:
Our company has a peculiar requirement from the legal team that:
- givenName is the given name of the user on their birth certificate
- sn is the surname of the user on their birth certificate
- displayName / cn is the name they go by day-to-day

So we end up with lots of cases such as "Mark Anderson" who are really "Chris Anderson" or "Steven Smith" who is "Paul Smith". This causes major confusion for our users who are only peripherally aware of the legal requirements, and don't know each other's legal names.

There are other cases where the legal name might have multiple names like "Jean Luc Picard" where the person might go by "Jean Picard". Searching on "Jean Picard" in this case when adding a user to a group or access controls fails, I believe.

The confusion is anywhere that Stash lists users such as the access controls, or group members. It affects search because it is really difficult to find these people.

Please change the behaviour so that when a "display name" is warranted, it will use "displayName" or "cn" (ideally configurable) instead of sandwiching "givenName" and "sn" together.

I'll note that different Atlassian tools work differently here, but most of them in my experience use a "displayName", and Stash is more of the odd man out here. I know this because our other tools - JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo, etc. don't seem to be having this problem. (I'll note that Confluence actually does it *both* ways... mostly they use "displayName" or "cn", but sometimes, as is the case with personal space titles, they use "givenName sn", and our users also complain about this...)
fields.summary: Stash should use LDAP "displayName" or "cn" instead of "givenName sn" for search and report purposes

fields.description:
We have discovered that certain files are displayed empty("The added file is empty") in the Pull reqests Diff view (and the commit view) despite their NOT. Looks like a problem in stash only because if you merge the pull request and get the files from the developer machines they are looking just fine. 
Not sure if it has something to do with naming of the actual files or something else, as you can see from the screenshot the name of the file is cropped both in the url and on the context path to the right.

In this pull requests all HSATEST* were displayed empty except HSATEST2-CFD.xml which was showed correctly. The other files were also displayed correctly.

In another pull request the file "npo_HSATEST2-C77.xml" was also displayed as empty...

I have attached both the screenshot and some of the xml-files we were having problem with.
fields.summary: Pull request/commit displays "The added file is empty" when it´s NOT

fields.description:
When trying to use the "Create branch" link from a JIRA issue users are not shown any error message in the UI if the operation fails.

In this case, I was trying to create the branch "bugfix/3.6-FECRU-123-foo" however a branch simply called "bugfix" existed in the repo already. This meant that my branch could not be created.

Feedback in the UI is needed for any failed operation such as this.
In this case, the error message could be:

"Unable to create branch named "bugfix/foo" because a branch named "bugfix" already exists in this repository. Either select a different branch name prefix, or remove the 'bugfix' branch to continue."
fields.summary: Errors are not being propagated to UI on Create branch screen

fields.description:
Based on [Office 2007 File Format MIME Types for HTTP Content Streaming|http://blogs.msdn.com/b/vsofficedeveloper/archive/2008/05/08/office-2007-open-xml-mime-types.aspx], add support for {{docx}}, {{xlsx}}, {{pptx}} and the corresponding template formats {{dotx}}, {{xltx}},{{potx}}:

|Mime type|extension|
|application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.presentation| pptx|
|application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.template| potx|
|application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.slideshow |ppsx|
|application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet|xlsx|
|application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.template |xltx|
|application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document| docx|
|application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.template| dotx|

For OpenOffice/LibreOffice, the MIME types are listed in [OpenDocument technical specification - Documents|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenDocument_technical_specification#Documents] and [OpenDocument technical specification - Templates|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenDocument_technical_specification#Templates].
fields.summary: Add Microsoft Office 2007 and OpenOffice MIME Types
Don't allow External User Directory to exceed the license using Default Group
Anchor links in markdown include a slash that causes them to work inconsistently
Make ordering of pre-receive hooks configurable

fields.description:
When creating a task from a comment in a diff and switching back to overview before saving or cancelling the task, the pull request overview incorrectly displays that there are open tasks even though the task was never created. 

Steps to recreate:
* Create a line comment in the diff view
* Click on create task
* Give the task a name
* Go back to the overview tab without clicking save or cancel
* Overview displays that there is an open task even though it was not saved.
fields.summary: Pull Request overview incorrectly displaying the number of tasks
Typo in German Translation

fields.description:
Our setup uses the private-fork model.

A build-bot scans open pull-requests, and tries to checkout the current 'fromRef' to run some automated Q/A.

Occasionally, it seems the refs/pull-requests/<X>/from ref isn't updated when the pull-request is updated. (I.E. new commits pushed to the from-branch of the pull-request). Neither is the new fromRef available in the toRef-repository. (Tested with direct commit-fetch)

In this case, the REST-API shows the updated commit-hash for the newly added commit, which cannot be fetched from the toRef-repository, which halts the checkout process.
fields.summary: Updated pull-request not reflected in ls-remote

fields.description:
I used Thunderbird 31.1.2 which is an excellent email threader.

Well turns out that stash notifications dont thread in Thunderbird which means they must not be setting mail headers that indicate how to thread

Namely References: and In-Reply-To:

I see the MessageID is being set

<JIRA-servicedesk-1251-3633907232089080@Stash>

But the IN-Reply-To is not a reference to a message id but some generated thingy

<JIRA-servicedesk-1251@Stash>

If it used the originating MessageID it would thread!

See - https://wiki.mozilla.org/MailNews:Message_Threading
fields.summary: Stash email notifications do not thread in Thunderbird

fields.description:
The suggestion is to create a *Pending* tab in the pull down menu (right upper corner of the screen) containing a list of Pull Requests that were already approved and are ready to be merged.

To justify it, when a reviewer has a Pul Request to approve, it shows up in the *Reviewing* tab. All the reviewers may approve the Pull Request, but they may let it to be merged in another time. So the idea of having a thir tab is to remember users of Pull Requests that were approved and are ready to be merged.
fields.summary: Create a "Pending" list of Pull Requests already approved

fields.description: It would be extremely useful to have a page where you could see your open pull requests as requester or reviewer. As it is, the only way of organizing these is by keeping the email alerts you receive; short of that, you have to go into each project, into each repository, and check the complete list of pull requests. In our case this could be dozens of repositories, each of which may have many pull requests.
fields.summary: Pull Requests Dashboard

fields.description:
The comment of my commit had *UTF-8* in it:

_Visual studio changed UTF-8 EOL to windows style CRLF_

In the commit page, in the column issues where the issue key is located, there is a issue key UTF-8 created. See attached file.
Of course, the link points to nowhere because it is not an issue key.
Obviously it have the same pattern has a key but is not.
fields.summary: Patterns like project Key for issues are considered has issues and add a link to them

fields.description: When a pull request is updated, if it was already approved by the reviewers before the update the Merge button is still active. It seems reasonable the pull request should be reviewed again after it gets updated, so the suggestion is to disable the *Merge* button, waiting for the pull request to be approved again.
fields.summary: Updated pull request should deactivate the Merge button

fields.description:
Currently, even if analytics has been disabled and/or the privacy policy update has not been acknowledged, Atlassian Analytics will still attempt to call out to S3 to download the most up-to-date blacklist & whitelist for Stash.

This *does not* involve sending out any data from the instance, just reading some flat lists of events that we do or do not want to collect (which are completely anonymous).

However, it makes sense to simply not download these at all if the user has opted to disable analytics, or has not yet acknowledged the privacy policy update.

Sample message in the log:
{code}
2014-09-23 17:06:07,569 WARN  [localScheduler_Worker-1]  c.a.a.client.s3.AnalyticsS3Client Couldn't download the remote list file config/allowedwords.dict, detailed message: Unable to execute HTTP request: Connect to btf-analytics.s3.amazonaws.com:443 timed out
{code}
fields.summary: Analytics tries to make downloads from contacts btf-analytics.s3.amazonaws.com although switched off or privacy policy accepted

fields.description:
Since configuring Crowd integration in Stash, I was able to get the directory synchronization and other parts of the authentication process to work. However in our setup, SSO is still not working correctly in Stash (works in JIRA and Confluence).

So I would log in on our home page at https://toolkit.xxxxxxxxxxxxxx.tld and the login page would set the following cookies:

  Set-Cookie:crowd.token_key=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX; domain=toolkit.xxxxxxxxxxxxxx.tld; path=/
  Set-Cookie:crowd.username=xxxxxxx; domain=toolkit.xxxxxxxxxxxxxx.tld; path=/

After this, I can visit other applications such as JIRA and Confluence that are configured for Crowd SSO and proceed without logging in.

========== crowd configuration ==========
toolkit.xxxxxxxxxxxxxx.tld is configured as the domain name.
mysql> use crowd;
mysql> select * from cwd_property WHERE property_name LIKE 'domain';
| property_key | property_name | property_value             |
| crowd        | domain        | toolkit.xxxxxxxxxxxxxx.tld |

========== application crowd configuration ==========
All of the apps on the server are running under separate tomcat instances and have both HTTP and AJP connections configured. Apache is responsible for proxying end user access the tomcat applications via the AJP connector. For example, when a user visits https://toolkit.xxxxxxxxxxxxxx.tld/stash, they are proxied to ajp://localhost:9013/stash; When a user visits https://toolkit.xxxxxxxxxxxxxx.tld/crowd they are proxied to ajp://localhost:9011/crowd. However when the applications running locally need to talk to crowd for directory synchronization or authentication they talk directly to crowd's HTTP connector: http://localhost:8011/crowd/services

Here's the Stash configuration:
mysql> use stash;
mysql> select * from cwd_directory_attribute;
| directory_id | attribute_value                       | attribute_name                                       |
|        32769 | atlassian-security                    | user_encryption_method                               |
|       229377 | toolkit-stash                         | application.name                                     |
|       229377 | XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX               | application.password                                 |
|       229377 | false                                 | com.atlassian.crowd.directory.sync.issynchronising   |
|       229377 | 67                                    | com.atlassian.crowd.directory.sync.lastdurationms    |
|       229377 | 1411501798895                         | com.atlassian.crowd.directory.sync.laststartsynctime |
|       229377 | http://localhost:8011/crowd/services/ | crowd.server.url                                     |
|       229377 | true                                  | crowd.sync.incremental.enabled                       |
|       229377 | 600                                   | directory.cache.synchronise.interval                 |
|       229377 | true                                  | useNestedGroups                                      |

stash-config.properties has:
plugin.auth-crowd.sso.enabled=true

========== Stash logs during SSO authentication attempt ==========
2014-09-23 14:55:39,675 DEBUG [ajp-bio-9014-exec-6] 895x37x1 172.16.45.8 "GET /rest/capabilities HTTP/1.1" c.a.s.i.s.s.PluginAuthenticationProvider attempting authentication with authenticator com.atlassian.stash.stash-auth-crowd-sso:crowdSsoAuthHandler
2014-09-23 14:55:39,688 INFO  [ajp-bio-9014-exec-6] 895x37x1 172.16.45.8 "GET /rest/capabilities HTTP/1.1" c.a.c.s.client.ClientPropertiesImpl Loading property: 'application.name' : 'toolkit-stash'
2014-09-23 14:55:39,688 INFO  [ajp-bio-9014-exec-6] 895x37x1 172.16.45.8 "GET /rest/capabilities HTTP/1.1" c.a.c.s.client.ClientPropertiesImpl Loading property: 'application.login.url' : 'https://toolkit.xxxxxxxxxxxxxx.tld/stash/login'
2014-09-23 14:55:39,688 INFO  [ajp-bio-9014-exec-6] 895x37x1 172.16.45.8 "GET /rest/capabilities HTTP/1.1" c.a.c.s.client.ClientPropertiesImpl Loading property: 'session.tokenkey' : 'atl.crowd.sso.tokenkey'
2014-09-23 14:55:39,688 INFO  [ajp-bio-9014-exec-6] 895x37x1 172.16.45.8 "GET /rest/capabilities HTTP/1.1" c.a.c.s.client.ClientPropertiesImpl Loading property: 'session.lastvalidation' : 'atl.crowd.sso.lastvalidation'
2014-09-23 14:55:39,688 INFO  [ajp-bio-9014-exec-6] 895x37x1 172.16.45.8 "GET /rest/capabilities HTTP/1.1" c.a.c.s.client.ClientPropertiesImpl Loading property: 'session.validationinterval' : '3'
2014-09-23 14:55:39,688 INFO  [ajp-bio-9014-exec-6] 895x37x1 172.16.45.8 "GET /rest/capabilities HTTP/1.1" c.a.c.s.client.ClientPropertiesImpl Failed to find value for property: cookie.domain
2014-09-23 14:55:39,696 DEBUG [ajp-bio-9014-exec-6] 895x37x1 172.16.45.8 "GET /rest/capabilities HTTP/1.1" c.a.s.p.a.c.i.CachingRetryingSupplier Failed to retrieve the value (Could not retrieve SSO Configuration ({1})), not retrying before Tue Sep 23 14:55:23 EDT 2014
2014-09-23 14:55:39,696 DEBUG [ajp-bio-9014-exec-6] 895x37x1 172.16.45.8 "GET /rest/capabilities HTTP/1.1" c.a.s.p.a.c.i.CrowdSsoAuthenticationHandler Skipping Crowd SSO as it is not enabled
2014-09-23 14:55:39,696 DEBUG [ajp-bio-9014-exec-6] 895x37x1 172.16.45.8 "GET /rest/capabilities HTTP/1.1" c.a.s.i.s.s.PluginAuthenticationProvider attempting authentication with authenticator com.atlassian.stash.stash-authentication:crowdHttpAuthHandler
2014-09-23 14:55:39,696 DEBUG [ajp-bio-9014-exec-6] 895x37x1 172.16.45.8 "GET /rest/capabilities HTTP/1.1" c.a.s.i.s.s.PluginAuthenticationProvider attempting authentication with authenticator com.atlassian.stash.stash-authentication:rememberMeAuthHandler
...This repeats a few times...

========== A TCP dump of stash communicating with crowd during the above transaction ==========
GET /crowd/rest/usermanagement/1/config/cookie HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/xml
Authorization: Basic XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
User-Agent: Jakarta Commons-HttpClient/3.1
Host: localhost:8011
Cookie: $Version=0; JSESSIONID=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX; $Path=/crowd

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
X-Embedded-Crowd-Version: Crowd/2.6.4
X-Crowd-User-Management-Version: 1.3
Content-Type: application/xml
Content-Length: 179
Date: Tue, 23 Sep 2014 21:21:47 GMT

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<cookie-config>
  <domain>toolkit.xxxxxxxxxxxxxx.tld</domain>
  <secure>false</secure>
  <name>crowd.token_key</name>
</cookie-config>

========== My notes ==========
The actual SSO error message seems to get ommited in the log files and instead the placeholder is displayed {1}.
The SSO cookies displayed above get sent to stash as confirmed by chrome developer tools.
Stash is able to communicate with crowd and all other features of crowd integration work in stash.
We're running Crowd version 2.6.4
Unable to upgrade to newest version of stash yet because it requires us to upgrade Java, which is a bit complicated due to the assortment of applications that would be impacted.
fields.summary: Crowd SSO: Could not retrieve SSO Configuration ({1})

fields.description: I would like the ability to set the project avatar to the default icon and choose a color.  If the system chooses red for the default avatar and I want to change it to green, then there should be a way to change it.  If I have uploaded my own custom avatar, and I decide that it is the wrong avatar or I have made a mistake then there should be an option to reset the project avatar to the default avatar with the color of my choosing.
fields.summary: Choose color for default project avatar

fields.description: It would be really convenient to allow task creation from the info area located in the upper right hand corner of the page (see attached screenshot).
fields.summary: Allow creation of pull request tasks from the info area

fields.description:
List all pull requests (Open, Merged, Declined) on one page for a project or the entire system.

While there is a third party add-on available ([All Pull Requests|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/sk.oxygene.stash.stash-all-pull-requests]) it would be nice to have this functionality baked into Stash and supported.
fields.summary: List all pull requests across repositories and system

fields.description:
Hello,

I think the integration of Fisheye into Stash is very poor atm. It provides nice features which are hardly used because developers hesitate to take this additional clicks to fisheye/crucible. I think it would be really helpful if the commit graph in fisheye would be integrated in stash so that developers can get a fast overview over the commit graph without the necessity to change to another service (fisheye).

Regards,
Manu
fields.summary: Improve Fisheye Stash integration with Commit graph

fields.description:
Stash got the strange idea of telling every user on every push to a branch how to create a pull request from this branch.

This is (a) annoying, and (b) may not, and, in our case, does not match the actual workflow we use.

Please put that functionality into a hook that can be disabled.

h1. Workaround

If you go to the 'Manage add-ons' section of the Stash admin screens, select 'System' from the dropdown, search for 'Bundled Hooks' expand it and its modules and find the 'print-branch-links-hook' module you can click disable to disable this feature
fields.summary: 'git push' adds verbose create-pullreq howto in console output

fields.description:
If a git commit message contains the strings "UTF-8" or "UTF-16", the commit gets linked to non-existant Issue (UTF-8 or UTF-16)

For example:
git commit -m "Changed encoding to UTF-8 for compatibility with Excel"

would have a link to https://<ourjiraserver>/browse/UTF-8
fields.summary: Commits with the string "UTF-8" or "UTF-16" create a link to a non-existant Jira bug

fields.description:
A separate Stash version of this JIRA 'environment' page may be called for, to address the best practice aspects:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Establishing+Staging+Server+Environments+for+JIRA

In the mean time, please follow the steps below to replicate your production environment to a different staging server.

- Backup your instance using our backup/restore tool. Please refer to:
-- [Backing up Stash using the client|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Using+the+Stash+Backup+Client#UsingtheStashBackupClient-BackingupStashusingtheclient]
- Restore your instance using our backup/restore tool. Please refer to:
-- [Restoring Stash into a newly created DB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Using+the+Stash+Backup+Client#UsingtheStashBackupClient-RestoringStashintoanewlycreatedDB] 
- Change your license into a development license using the UI: {{Administration >> License >> Edit License}}. Please refer to the link below in order to get the steps to generate a development license:
-- [FAQ - 9. Would additional licenses be needed if the software is deployed on a development server or staging server for testing purposes?|https://www.atlassian.com/licensing/purchase-licensing#licensing-9]
fields.summary: Create CAC documentation for how to set up a staging server

fields.description:
We are currently using stash behind an apache reverse proxy.

The stash installer is really great as I can use a preconfigured unattended configuration to minimize setup/update time, but currently I have to manually edit the server.xml file after each update.

It would be great to have the ability to define those settings in the stash response file so I can have a production-ready instance running directly.
fields.summary: Make proxy settings configurable in stash installer
